ccre.igneous

Class Igneous

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.igneous.Igneous
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IgneousCore

    public class Igneous
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class to access Igneous channels.
    Author:
    skeggsc

      • constantPeriodic

        public static final EventInput constantPeriodic
        Constant time periodic. Should pulse every 10 ms, as accurately as possible.

    • Method Detail

      • getKinectJoystick

        public static final IJoystick getKinectJoystick(boolean isRightArm)
        Get an IJoystick for the specified Kinect virtual joystick. Joysticks on the driver station are accessed through the variables joystick1...joystick4.
        Parameters:
        isRightArm - If the right arm joystick should be used instead of the left. (6 instead of 5 if you're used to the old system.)
        Returns:
        the IJoystick.

      • makeJaguarMotor

        public static FloatOutput makeJaguarMotor(int id,
                          boolean negate,
                          float ramping)
        Create a reference to a Jaguar speed controller on the specified ID and motor reversal, with a specified ramping rate. If the ramping rate is zero, then no ramping is applied. Don't use this if you don't know what you're doing! Otherwise, the ramping rate is the maximum difference allowed per 10 milliseconds (constantPeriodic). (So a rate of 0.1f means that you need 200 milliseconds to go from -1.0 to 1.0.)
        Parameters:
        id - the motor port ID, from 1 to 10, inclusive.
        negate - MOTOR_FORWARD if the motor direction should be unmodified, MOTOR_REVERSE if the motor direction should be reversed.
        ramping - the ramping rate.
        Returns:
        the output that will output to the specified motor.
        See Also:
        MOTOR_FORWARD, MOTOR_REVERSE

      • makeVictorMotor

        public static FloatOutput makeVictorMotor(int id,
                          boolean negate,
                          float ramping)
        Create a reference to a Victor speed controller on the specified ID and motor reversal, with a specified ramping rate. If the ramping rate is zero, then no ramping is applied. Don't use this if you don't know what you're doing! Otherwise, the ramping rate is the maximum difference allowed per 10 milliseconds (constantPeriodic). (So a rate of 0.1f means that you need 200 milliseconds to go from -1.0 to 1.0.)
        Parameters:
        id - the motor port ID, from 1 to 10, inclusive.
        negate - MOTOR_FORWARD if the motor direction should be unmodified, MOTOR_REVERSE if the motor direction should be reversed.
        ramping - the ramping rate.
        Returns:
        the output that will output to the specified motor.
        See Also:
        MOTOR_FORWARD, MOTOR_REVERSE

      • makeTalonMotor

        public static FloatOutput makeTalonMotor(int id,
                         boolean negate,
                         float ramping)
        Create a reference to a Talon speed controller on the specified ID and motor reversal, with a specified ramping rate. If the ramping rate is zero, then no ramping is applied. Don't use this if you don't know what you're doing! Otherwise, the ramping rate is the maximum difference allowed per 10 milliseconds (constantPeriodic). (So a rate of 0.1f means that you need 200 milliseconds to go from -1.0 to 1.0.)
        Parameters:
        id - the motor port ID, from 1 to 10, inclusive.
        negate - MOTOR_FORWARD if the motor direction should be unmodified, MOTOR_REVERSE if the motor direction should be reversed.
        ramping - the ramping rate.
        Returns:
        the output that will output to the specified motor.
        See Also:
        MOTOR_FORWARD, MOTOR_REVERSE

      • makeSolenoid

        public static BooleanOutput makeSolenoid(int id)
        Create a reference to a solenoid on the specified port.
        Parameters:
        id - the port of the solenoid.
        Returns:
        the output that will control the solenoid.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the output that will control the digital output.

        averageBits - the number of averaging bits.

        Parameters:

        averageBits - the number of averaging bits.
        Returns:
        the analog input, reporting in uncalibrated units.

      • makeServo

        public static FloatOutput makeServo(int id,
                    float minInput,
                    float maxInput)
        Create a reference to a servo controller for the specified port and minimum and maximum values.
        Parameters:
        id - the port number.
        minInput - the value on the output that should correspond to the servo's minimum position.
        maxInput - the value on the output that should correspond to the servo's maximum position.
        Returns:
        the FloatOutput that controls the servo.

        public static FloatOutput makeDSFloatReadout(java.lang.String prefix,
                             int line)
        Create an output that will display the current value on the driver station's LCD.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix, or label, of the output. this is prepended to the value.
        line - the line to display the value on, from 1 to 6.
        Returns:
        the output that will write to the LCD.

        public static void makeDSFloatReadout(java.lang.String prefix,
                      int line,
                      FloatInputPoll value,
                      EventInput when)
        Display the current value of the specified FloatInputPoll on the driver station's LCD, whenever the specified event is triggered.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix, or label, of the output. this is prepended to the value.
        line - the line to display the value on, from 1 to 6.
        value - the value to display.
        when - when to update the output.

        value - the value to display.

      • useCompressor

        public static void useCompressor(int pressureSwitchChannel,
                 int compressorRelayChannel)
        Activate the compressor on the given pressure switch channel and compressor relay channel.
        Parameters:
        pressureSwitchChannel - the channel of the pressure switch digital input.
        compressorRelayChannel - the channel of the compressor's relay.

      • usePCMCompressor

        public static BooleanOutput usePCMCompressor()
        Get control of the PCM-attached compressor. This makes sure that the PCM compressor is running the closed loop control.
        Returns:
        a BooleanOutput that can turn closed loop control on and off.

      • getPCMPressureSwitch

        public static BooleanInputPoll getPCMPressureSwitch()
        Reads the current status of the PCM pressure switch.
        Returns:
        the pressure switch status.

      • getPCMCompressorRunning

        public static BooleanInputPoll getPCMCompressorRunning()
        Reads the current status of the PCM compressor enable output.
        Returns:
        the compressor enable output.

      • getPCMCompressorCurrent

        public static FloatInputPoll getPCMCompressorCurrent()
        Reads the current draw of the PCM compressor.
        Returns:
        the current being used by the compressor.

      • useCustomCompressor

        public static void useCustomCompressor(BooleanInputPoll shouldDisable,
                       int compressorRelayChannel)
        Activate the compressor on the given pressure switch input and compressor relay channel.
        Parameters:
        shouldDisable - should the compressor be turned off.
        compressorRelayChannel - the channel of the compressor's relay.

      • makeEncoder

        public static FloatInputPoll makeEncoder(int aChannel,
                         int bChannel,
                         boolean reverse,
                         EventInput resetWhen)
        Create a reference to an Encoder on the specified ports with the specified number of average bits.
        Parameters:
        aChannel - The alpha-channel for the encoder.
        bChannel - The beta-channel for the encoder.
        reverse - Should the result of the encoder be negated?
        resetWhen - If provided, the Encoder's value will be reset when this event is produced.
        Returns:
        the Encoder, reporting encoder ticks.

      • makeEncoder

        public static FloatInputPoll makeEncoder(int aChannel,
                         int bChannel,
                         boolean reverse)
        Create a reference to an Encoder on the specified ports with the specified number of average bits.
        Parameters:
        aChannel - The alpha-channel for the encoder.
        bChannel - The beta-channel for the encoder.
        reverse - Should the result of the encoder be negated?
        Returns:
        the Encoder, reporting encoder ticks.

      • makeForwardRelay

        public static BooleanOutput makeForwardRelay(int channel)
        Create a reference to the Forward side of the relay on the specified channel - this side can be turned on and off.
        Parameters:
        channel - The relay channel.
        Returns:
        the output that will modify the forward side of the channel.

      • makeReverseRelay

        public static BooleanOutput makeReverseRelay(int channel)
        Create a reference to the Reverse side of the relay on the specified channel - this side can be turned on and off.
        Parameters:
        channel - The relay channel.
        Returns:
        the output that will modify the reverse side of the channel.

      • makeGyro

        public static FloatInputPoll makeGyro(int port,
                      double sensitivity,
                      EventInput evt)
        Create a reference to a Gyro on the specified port with the specified sensitivity. This will allow reading the current rotation of the Gyro. This also takes an EventInput, and when this is fired, the Gyro will be reset. Increased sensitivity means a smaller output for the same turn.
        Parameters:
        port - The Gyro port number.
        sensitivity - The sensitivity of the Gyro. This is the number of volts/degree/second sensitivity of the gyro and is used in calculations to allow the code to work with multiple gyros. 0.007 is a good default value.
        evt - When to reset the Gyro.
        Returns:
        The reference to the Gyro's current value.

      • makeGyro

        public static FloatInputPoll makeGyro(int port,
                      double sensitivity)
        Create a reference to a Gyro on the specified port with the specified sensitivity. This will allow reading the current rotation of the Gyro. Increased sensitivity means a smaller output for the same turn.
        Parameters:
        port - The Gyro port number.
        sensitivity - The sensitivity of the Gyro. This is the number of volts/degree/second sensitivity of the gyro and is used in calculations to allow the code to work with multiple gyros. 0.007 is a good default value.
        Returns:
        The reference to the Gyro's current value.

      • makeAccelerometerAxis

        public static FloatInputPoll makeAccelerometerAxis(int port,
                                   double sensitivity,
                                   double zeropoint)
        Create a reference to a Accelerometer Axis on the specified port, with the specified sensitivity and voltage zero point.
        Parameters:
        port - The port number to attach to.
        sensitivity - The sensitivity of the accelerometer. This varies per model.
        zeropoint - The voltage that corresponds to 0 G. This also varies by model.
        Returns:
        The reference to the axis on the Accelerometer.

      • registerAutonomous

        public static void registerAutonomous(InstinctModule module)
        Register the specified InstinctModule as an autonomous mode. Note that registering multiple autonomous modes probably won't work properly.
        Parameters:
        module - the InstinctModule to register.
